comment.author: 15410137@N05
comment._content: My ancestor Robert Thomson (Thomsons Bay) and his large family was granted land near the saltworks and worked them before their land was reclaimed by the government to make Rottnest Island a prison. Some aboriginals stole his boat and escaped back to the mainland. He died at Kangaroo Island, South Australia (where he lived after his wife Caroline died in Western Australia). He had been living with a son and his family (Kingscote, K.I. area). Robert and his family arrived at the Swan River Colony in late 1829, the year that Perth was founded.
